column2: Land of Opportunity
Our country is seen as a land of opportunity and a popular destination for migrants.
The Indian Union
For the first time in over a thousand years, India is unified.
Propaganda Dispersed
We are dispersing propaganda in the Australian provinces.
Propaganda Dispersed
We are dispersing propaganda in the Australian provinces.
Union Loyalists
This province is a center of pro-Union sentiment.
Imperial Loyalists
This province is a center of pro-Imperial sentiment.
Funding Proxy
We are funding our proxy in Australia.
Demoralizing the Enemy
We are demoralizing the enemy proxy in Australia.
Company Rule
We are a company, not a nation.
Monarchy Questioned
Our nation is divided as to whether it should be a monarchy or a republic.
Occupied Capital
Our capital has been occupied by the enemy, and our nation is being horribly hurt by this.
The End of the Irish Dispute
Our nation is recovering from the end of the chaotic Irish dispute.
Australian Instability
Pro-Union and Pro-Imperial sentiments threaten to tear Australia apart.
The End of the Australian War
Our nation is recovering from the end of the chaotic Australian War.
Preparting Support
Our agents are working behind the scenes to prepare for the final battle with the enemy.
Papal Leadership
Garibaldi's forces are working to unify Italy under us.
Nationalist Sentiment
A new wave of Pan-Nationalism is sweeping the Italian peninsula.
The American Division
Our people wish to defend our conception of American Republicanism against the other side's.
Anti-Noble Sentiment
Socialist agitation is making the nobility less popular.
Discontented Nobility
The nobles are frustrated with our dynasty for our anti-noble policies.
Contented Nobility
The nobles are pleased that we support them.
Pro-Monarchy sentiment.
Our egalitarian policies are pleasing many in France.
Outdated Military
The tactics, equipment, and officers of our armed forces are extremely outdated.
Selling Supplies
We are tallying our surplus for the year.
Gwangmu Reform
We are reforming our nation to become more like the Western powers.
The Hundred Days Reform
For one brief period, our nation is attempting to rapidly modernize.
The Twilight of the Qing
The age of the Qing seems to be drawing to a close.
Cultural Complacency
Our belief in our superior culture makes us blind to what the West has to offer.
Self-Strengthening Movement
We are making cautious reforms with the goal of increasing China's strength.
The Opium Trade
The scourge of opium is ravaging our subjects.
Westernizers Favored
We currently favor Westernizers for appointments in the government.
Slavophiles Favored
We currently favor Slavophiles for appointments in the government.
The Iron Chancellor
Otto von Bismarck is governing our nation.
Union Tensions
Our Brazilian and Portuguese subjects are beginning to believe that a Union between our two Kingdoms necessarily favors one of the Kingdoms' interests over the other.
Funding the Greeks
We are supplying the Greeks in their revolt against the Turks.
Nationalist Agitation
Nationalists are active in the province, stirring up trouble with random acts of violence. If left unchecked, they may rise in rebellion against us.
Independence Societies
Societies pushing for independence from the Union have been agitating public opinion in this province.
Prussian Influence
Our military tactics are strongly influenced by Prussian strategy.
Damascus Steel
Our rediscovery of how to forge Damascus Steel has made our armies stronger than ever before.
Russian Instability
Many Russians view our government as illegitimate and weak.
Germanization Policy
We are pursuing a policy of centalization and forcible assimilation.
Dualist Policy
We are pursuing a policy of dualism and working with the Magyars to maintain order.
Federalist Policy
We are pursuing a policy of federalism in which all minorities have equal rights.
Semi-Autonomous province
This province has been granted a great deal of independence from the government in Vienna.
Crushed Ambitions
This province has recently had its dreams of even greater autonomy crushed.
Heavy Military Presence
The crushing of rebellion in this province has lead to it being occupied by many wary troops.
Bengali Migration Limit
Our country bans the migration of all Bengalis out of our country.
